Nedzu watched with amusement through the security cameras he was given access to as the HPSC went through a power transfer. Not one they wished willingly to have, but with the amount of blackmail evidence being dangled behind that wide toothy smile and sharp green eyes, well, what could they do? Say no? That would risk a total upheaval of society itself and more than a little jail time. So he was given the privilege of watching the old president of the HPSC get forcefully escorted out of her office as the newly dubbed president, despite his young age, watched on. His face was unreadable past the polite smile that seemed carved into his skin. 
 A wonderful way to spend his Saturday morning.
 He could still remember the first time he was approached by the now president. Having already finished all of his necessary schooling and just starting on his first college degree, the newly dubbed teen had shown up at his private gate along the UA wall and politely asked for a meeting. Considering not even the faculty knew of that entrance? It was safe to assume he was curious. 
What had followed was a fascinating discovery of another brilliant mind that could not only challenge him, but outdo him when it came to a select few topics. It was marvelous and he had immediately pushed forth for a weekly tea time between them. He wouldn’t dare let an opportunity such as that one slide past him. 
He chuckled at the memory of the flustered mess the teen had become, embarrassed and yet validated on a level that bordered on desperate. Considering the label of quirkless, it wasn’t a surprise. He was glad that society hadn’t had the time to instill a crippling amount of self-deprecation in him or he may have never been given the chance to know him. 
Society was always so good at snuffing out that which scares it, silencing the minority while placing those it deems worthy on pedestals. 
(He had a lab setting for his worst nightmare, this teen didn't have such a luxury. How sad is it, then, that something so horrendous could be considered better?)
Thus, he watched. A wide smile that would send his faculty running stretched onto his face as someone who was at the bottom of the barrel just 3 years ago reached out and grabbed his fate with his own hands, yanking it out of society's clutches and making a path for himself.
.
.
.
.
“Are you being serious? I have no time for games, Nedzu,” he asked irritatedly.
 There was just no way that after all this time, the HPSC would suddenly change its mind. They’ve been keeping UA underneath a microscope for so long, picking at them like vultures to a dead carcass, yet suddenly they want to be cooperative? He doesn’t believe for a second.
 “I am Shouta-kun. I understand your reservations about this all-”
 “Justifiable caution.”
 “-considering previous attitudes, however there is a very easy explanation as to why the HPSC is being so… lenient.” The rat finished, an amused grin in place of his normal polite smile.
 “And what, pray tell, is this explanation,” he grouched, eyes narrowed in disbelief.
 He knew Nedzu wasn’t joking, hell the rat hated the HPSC more than he did. Yet, he just couldn’t believe that the group of stuck up fuckers that reigned like overlords behind the scenes of the world of heroics would be so accepting. Especially considering the attitude the president had, he had only met them once and that was enough for a lifetime.
 Nedzu flashed him a smile he reserved for moments of true victory, all predatory and pleased.
He was instantly thrown off guard.
 “Simple, the previous president of the HPSC was removed from office yesterday morning and the replacement is actually a good friend of mine. Someone who knows quite a bit of the dark side of society and wishes to change it.”
 The mug that was placed firmly in his hands slipped.
 “What,” he asked flatly, face blank in shock.
 “I do quite enjoy our tea sessions, though I suppose he will be a bit too busy for the next few months as he adjusts. I guess I’ll have to push back our tea time to a later date.” The rat contemplated, completely ignoring him. A little deserved since he just shattered a mug on Nedzu’s floor, but he also just had the metaphorical rug ripped out from underneath him so he feels a little justified.
 “The president of the HPSC was replaced on Saturday and no one was notified,” he stated calmly, a stark difference to the internal chaos he was feeling.
 “Yes!” The Rat chirped. “He’ll be paying a visit during the exam’s for the incoming 1st years, he’s quite curious about the effectiveness of the new exam format!”
 “Is there a reason as to why this changing of power, one that effects the entire fucking country, was done in absolute secret without anyone knowing?” He ignored the fact that Nedzu knew. 
He always knows.
 “Ah, that’s because the president was coerced into giving up her position!” Hold on a minute- “Don’t worry, the hero community will be notified once the new year starts!” He wasn’t worried about when they would be notified anymore, what did Nedzu just say? “The current president wants to make some small changes beforehand.”
 What the actual fuck was happening???
.

.
.
“Shouta? Is there something wrong love?”
 “The world is ending, Hizashi, the rat has friends and they're just as bad as the chimera himself.”
 “Oh- oh no.”
.

.

He gave his mirror a polite smile as he finished tying the knot on his tie, fortunately not looking like he was attempting to strangle himself for once. All that practice had paid off.
 He walked out and gave his mom a goodbye hug, one she happily reciprocated after worrying about him to make sure he looked presentable, before heading out of the apartments to reach his chauffeur. When he reached the inconspicuous car he had chosen- why use an expensive car if it’ll stick out like a sore thumb?- he huffed an amused breath as red entered his vision, the host grinning a bright grin that had become increasingly more common since Saturday.
 “I assume you're my ‘bodyguard’ then?” He asked the winged hero.
 “Absolutely Boss-man!” Keigo chirped. “I was appointed-”
 “Self-appointed,” he cut in, amused.
 “-as your one and only bodyguard for any and all things. Can’t let you go out alone, green bean, that's dangerous.” Keigo grinned a shit-eating grin as he held open the door from him, a single hand waving off his words.
 With an amused glance, he was going to UA which was objectively the safest place in japan for him to be at that wasn’t the HPSC headquarters, he took the offered seat and slid into the car. Keigo sitting in the passenger seat up front with his driver.
 “We shall arrive at UA within the hour, sir,” a voice chimed from the driver's seat.
 “Thank you Aoki,” he said with a proper smile, one he knew the man would see through the rearview mirror. 
Aoki was amazing at his job. The man had been reduced to grunt work despite his skill set due to pissing off the previous president. He, upon noticing this, immediately asked if Aoki would be willing to be promoted to his secretary. The man had agreed readily considering his family and the pay increase, but as time passed- as short as it has been- it was obvious he was enjoying his work a lot more than he did before. He would go as far as saying they were close enough to be called friends now.
 “Always, sir,” Aoki responded, a soft smile on the usually stern face.
 They pulled out of the complex parking lot and began their way to UA, Keigo belting out his favorite songs as Aoki restrained himself from decking the man as they drove. Noticing this, Keigo began to sing even louder- if that was even possible- which led to Aoki’s patience snapping and a particularly sharp turn led to Keigo’s face being plastered to his own window. A giggle escaped him as he held onto the door to keep upright.
 “Apologies for the sharp turn sir, I needed to avoid a pothole.”
 Waving off the words, a smirk on his own face, he turned to look out the window as the world passed by in a blur as they drove. The smirk melting into a satisfied smile as a content sigh passed his lips.
 Things needed changing, and now?
Now he gets to be the catalyst that starts it all.
.

“Who’s this cutie?!” Nemuri cooed as she reached out to pet green curls.
 Shouta was sitting next to Nedzu at the head of the monitor room where they were all currently waiting for the written exams to end. They had only been there for a few minutes when Hawks, the current number 3 hero which was impressive for his age, walked in while holding the door open for a kid and another person. The kid was short, reaching what looks to be no taller than 166cm, and had the curliest green hair he has ever seen. Wincing in sympathy, he blew some of his own wild black curls out of his face. He could barely tame his own hair, when he tried, let alone the bird’s nest that was on the newcomers. 
The other person who had walked in was tall, probably as tall as he was, with a blank look to his face that rivaled his own. Short dark purple hair was slicked back, revealing the almost unnoticeable com in his right ear. A quick glance showed that, sure enough, all three of them had com’s placed inconspicuously on their bodies. If it wasn’t for his experience as an under, he doubted he would’ve noticed them at all.
 “Ah, Midnight-san,” the kid greeted, a small nod sent in her direction, “A pleasure. My name is Midoriya Izuku.”
 With a squeal, Nemuri ruffled the kids' curls. Marveling over how soft they were with a slight amount of teasing. Hizashi, who was getting ready to leave for the auditorium, gave a small coo at the kid for acting all formal. Shouta, however, didn’t dare. There was something off about this random kid's appearance that didn’t sit well with him. What kind of kid had access to a com system and the secret observation room for UA’s entrance exams? Not a normal one, that’s for sure. 
There was also the slight twitch of the purple haired man’s right hand when Nemuri reached to ruffle the kid's curls. An involuntary action that, no matter how much you try, can’t be concealed. One that’s present in most bodyguards that are armed. 
Whoever this kid was, they were being guarded closely. 
 His unasked question was answered when sharp green eyes snapped over to the seat next to him, Nedzu’s whiskers twitching with glee. The smile that stretched over freckled cheeks was unnerving at best, but it was the dead eyes that accompanied it that really set him on edge. He’s seen that expression on Nedzu's own furry features several times. 
Suddenly, he remembered the conversation he had with Nedzu about the exam changes with a single moment of clarity before the dread set in.
 No-
 “Nedzu-chan,” the kid chirped as the faculty choked, “How’s the processing so far?”
 Dear god.
 “Well Izuku-chan,” Nedzu greeted just as fondly, uncaring of the shivers he sent down their backs, “it seems to be going quite well! Yamada-kun, if you will?”
 He knew it, the world was ending and it was all this sadist-sunshine child’s fault. There was no way someone got so close to Nedzu without having or adopting some of the rat’s more eccentric tendencies. Sadism is just the best bet at the moment.
 Tentatively, Hizashi nodded as he went to leave. Tossing glances back until the door was fully closed. The room was rendered silent as they observed the kid in front of them happily chatting with Nedzu. Random acronyms and words being tossed in that he hadn’t heard of before and really didn’t want to know either, such as the suspicious combination of letters A.D.M.B. in reference to defense systems.
 “Uh, Nedzu-san,” spoke up a hesitant, familiar voice, “what is…Uh, Midoriya-kun?” The kid gave a nod, confirming that it was indeed his name, but the all knowing smile that followed it made the man gulp. “Midoriya-kun doing here?”
 “Oh? I explained a few days ago that he would be coming, did you forget Yagi-san?”
 Shouta groaned, sounding more like a dying man by the minute, into the silence that followed Nedzu’s statement. The teachers snapped their gazes to him questioningly as he face planted into his own hands.
 “Problem child,” he grumbled, looking up enough to catch Midoriya’s gaze, “I’m not explaining,” he voiced to the rest of the room.
 The kid chuckled, amused eyes that still held that sharpness looked towards Nedzu questioningly. He let out an inaudible sigh of relief, glad that those eyes were off of him now. The brat had the same gaze Nedzu did, one that told you your every move was being considered and deciphered until you were as easy to read as a children's picture book. 
 Nedzu gave Midoriya a nod, a feral smile accompanying it as Midoriya turned around to fully address the room.
 “It’s a bit early, the announcement was going to be delivered a week from now but what's the harm? Let me reintroduce myself,” a blinding smile replaced the polite one from earlier, “My name is Midoriya Izuku, the current president of the Hero Public Safety Commission.”
The room was silent.
“I look forward to working with you all. Oh! I nearly forgot,” a predatory smile appeared on his face, “it’s a pleasure to meet the number 1, even if it’s the second time, Yagi-san.”

The exams progressed smoothly after that, the room of teachers all too shocked to do much else than to fall into autopilot mode. Especially Yagi, who looked to be questioning life itself as he glanced warily at the green child talking amicably with Nedzu in the seats closest to the monitors.
 The new format had three different exam styles that the potential students could choose from based on what they assumed they would excel in. Destructive or ‘flashy’ quirks could choose the original exam which used the usual battle city scenario with robots, mental or subtle quirks could choose the one-on-one battle scenario where they would fight one of ectoplasm’s clones, or a third exam which no one was given the details to but Nedzu seemed especially happy about. 
 At one point during the exam, Midoriya had broken into what could only be called a mutter storm. A hand resting across his mouth as he spoke, twitching as if it wanted to write, muffling the already quiet sound. Nedzu was leaning in, listening intently as Midoriya lost himself to his own thoughts for a good few minutes. At the end of it, Nedzu’s face broke into an animalistic smile that sent shivers down their spines before he reached for the student list. Pawing through it until he reached a specific one, he pulled it out and placed it to the side.
 He was curious (sue him), so he moved towards the front, already knowing he was risking life and limb.
 (Dramatic but also completely acceptable considering who he was getting close to.)
 “Ah, hello Eraserhead,” Midoriya greeted cordially. 
 He pushed down the urge to shudder, refusing to ask why this child knew his hero name. Yes he was the president of the HPSC, but he was also a president that was newly ‘elected’. He sincerely doubts the kid had enough time to go through every hero listed in their database, which means his name was either specifically searched for, or the kid knew of him for far longer than he wanted to know.
 He gave a nod in return, already reaching to read the selected paper. 
 The photo of the selected student showcased wild purple hair and deep eyebags. ‘Shinsou Hitoshi’ was the name. The kid obviously needed to work on his stamina, considering he had almost failed the one-on-one tests, but he pulled through with his quirk. 
 “Curious?” Midoriya asked, his sharp eyes once again intently staring at him.
 “Yes,” he admitted. What good would it do to lie? He’s almost 100% sure he’d be seen through anyways, no matter how good his poker face was.
 “Well, Shinsou-kun needs more focused training for his body, that much is clear, but based on his performance and the potential hidden within his quirk it would be a shame to lose him to the general education track. I do believe your particular brand of teaching would suit him well, don't you?” 
 This time he couldn’t hold back the shudder, cursing himself for it as he saw a flash of amusement dancing behind emerald green eyes. There was something unnerving about this kid, something so reminiscent of Nedzu that it made him want to crawl into his sleeping bag and never wake up again. No one needed two Nedzu’s. For fucks sake the world was barely hanging on with just one.
 “Yes,” he managed to get out, “I had similar thoughts.”
 “Good!” Nedzu chirped, abruptly reminding them all of his presence. “Since he’s just been accepted into class 1-A.”
 He groaned internally, questioning all of his life choices that led him to this moment. Sighing heavily, which earned him an amused smile from Midoriya, he sagged into the last seat left at the front of the monitoring room. He was already here, might as well stay for the long run. 
 “Oooh,” Nedzu started, his voice edged in a way that made Shouta sit up straighter, “It seems you were correct once again Izuku-chan.”
 Midoriya perked up, eyes roaming the screens before it settled on the one showcasing a teen with an explosion quirk. Following his gaze, Shouta cringed at the feral smile that decorated the blonde’s face as he destroyed the robots. Great, another superiority complex having flashy quirk user. 
 “Ah,” Midoriya said, giving a small nod as if confirming his own thoughts, “Of course. Bakugo has always been very… aggressive with his approach to heroics.”
 Suddenly, green eyes were on him again as a single eyebrow raised in question, a curious look on Midoriya’s face as he watched his expression intently.
 “Say, Eraserhead,” the teen(?) drawled, “how much do you enjoy destroying world views and correcting societies mistakes when it comes to enforcing biased world views through academic environments?”
 His eyes sharpened as he glanced from the screen then back to Midoriya.
 “About a solid 6 on a scale of 10, though I do find it a necessary nuisance.”
 “Lovely,” Midoriya chirped before going back to watching the screens, Nedzu pulling another paper out and placing it on top of Shinsou’s.
 This is how the exam watching progressed for the next few hours. Random interruptions from Nedzu and Midoriya as they talked to each other, and occasionally himself, watching the students finish their exams. By the end, there were already two stacks of potential applicants for both Vlad and himself to go through. Each stack tailored based on who would do good under which teaching style. Midoriya stood up with a polite smile, a more genuine one than the one he had from when he walked in, heading to the door where Hawks and the other were standing at attention.
 “Well, I’m afraid that I must head out, though I enjoyed my time here. Thank you for the invitation, Nedzu-chan,” Midoriya said, words soft and joyful.
 “Of course Izuku-chan! I’m just sorry that we’ll need to push back tea time, considering how busy we’ll both be very soon. Your insights on the exam were certainly informative!” The rat responded, tail switching in delight.
 With a final dismissal, the teen left and the room plunged into silence once again. Each of the teachers stared at each other in the same bewilderment from earlier. That was until Hizashi walked through the door, a strained smile on his face before he spoke.
 “So, our new boss is a very green- adorable- sunshine child? How did that even happen?”
 The only response was the delighted cackles from Nedzu.

Spinning his chair around, he came face to face with someone he never imagined he would ever see in his entire life while working at the HPSC. Standing there, hair styled back to reveal the full force of the apathetic face he was wearing, was Tsugikuni Aoki. The fucking secretary of the 

President of the HPSC

God he wanted to 

cry

exactly

Hawks

.

How cliche of the 

President 

of the fucking 

Hero Public Safety 

Commission.

young 

sounding voice.

“There's a few questions I wish to ask you about concerning the documents that pass through your desk,” Midoriya Izuku- according to the nameplate on his desk- said, sharp green eyes staring directly through his soul as he smiled, “and a few regarding to the orders you received concerning those documents, if you don’t mind 

thoroughly

won

(First Day of the New School Year)

 

“Good Morning,” Nedzu chirped, his tail wiggling a bit in excitement as he sat on the staff lounge’s couch. 

 

Considering class was supposed to start within the hour, all of the faculty were there to jump in surprise at his sudden presence. All but one. Shouta had always been hyper aware of things when he was a student, especially when it concerned himself. He had wanted to cultivate that talent so he did. He was glad his lessons seemed to help quite a bit, he never really could startle the man anymore unless he was actively focusing on him specifically, Shouta was one of the few humans Nedzu considered a friend.

 

A chorus of greetings echoed in the room as the clearly exhausted faculty tried to wake up before dealing with, and he quotes, “demon children born from the culmination of human sin”.

 

“Nedzu,” Shouta’s gruff voice cut through the air and the room went silent, the man had sounded 
wary, "what did you do?”

 

Instantly, several pairs of eyes snapped to him with unveiled terror. The air in the room grew heavy under the weight of the tension. Unable to help himself, Nedzu grinned. All sharp and bared teeth as he stared at them all. Amused as he watched his faculty shudder in fear before he spoke.

 

“How harsh Shouta-kun,” he said, reigning back his elation and smoothing the grin into a polite smile, “I’m just excited for a segment that will be happening in about,” he glanced at the clock on the wall and grinned once again, “a minute or two.”

 

“What segmen-” Vlad had started before he was cut off by a cheery chime that seemed to resonate in the room.

 

Suddenly, the lights of the faculty room dimmed and a rather large section of the wall behind him started to open to reveal a screen. Playing on the flat screen tv was the local new station, the speakers in the room instantly syncing up to the audio.

 

“Officially,” the news reporter started, his voice echoing in the room as the faculty stared at the screen in silence, “as of an hour ago, the president of the Hero Public Safety Commission has changed.
